payload.content: From a purely mathematical perspective, there is no structural difference between an agent and a rock, as both execute policies that map inputs to outputs.

name: From a purely mathematical perspective, there is no structural difference betwee
content: From a purely mathematical perspective, there is no structural difference between an agent and a rock, as both execute policies that map inputs to outputs.

payload.content: The distinction between an agent and a rock lies in the sophistication of internal computations, specifically whether the system engages in planning and counterfactual reasoning, or if it merely acts as a lookup table.

name: The distinction between an agent and a rock lies in the sophistication of intern
content: The distinction between an agent and a rock lies in the sophistication of internal computations, specifically whether the system engages in planning and counterfactual reasoning, or if it merely acts as a lookup table.

payload.content: The Black Box Problem of Agency refers to the difficulty of determining whether a system is truly planning or just executing a pre-computed response, a question that is nearly impossible to answer from external observation.

name: The Black Box Problem of Agency refers to the difficulty of determining whether
content: The Black Box Problem of Agency refers to the difficulty of determining whether a system is truly planning or just executing a pre-computed response, a question that is nearly impossible to answer from external observation.

payload.content: The best approach to the Black Box Problem of Agency is to identify which model provides the simplest explanation for observed behavior.

name: The best approach to the Black Box Problem of Agency is to identify which model
content: The best approach to the Black Box Problem of Agency is to identify which model provides the simplest explanation for observed behavior.

payload.content: Energy-Based Models (EBMs) differ from standard neural networks because EBMs optimize both weights and internal states, whereas traditional networks only optimize weights.

name: Energy-Based Models (EBMs) differ from standard neural networks because EBMs opt
content: Energy-Based Models (EBMs) differ from standard neural networks because EBMs optimize both weights and internal states, whereas traditional networks only optimize weights.

payload.content: The complex, non-smooth nature of olfactory space may have driven the evolution of the associative cortex and planning abilities in the brain.

name: The complex, non-smooth nature of olfactory space may have driven the evolution
content: The complex, non-smooth nature of olfactory space may have driven the evolution of the associative cortex and planning abilities in the brain.

payload.content: Yann LeCun's Joint Embedding Prediction Architecture (JEPA) suggests that learning in latent space, rather than predicting every pixel, is key to more robust AI representations.

name: Yann LeCun's Joint Embedding Prediction Architecture (JEPA) suggests that learni
content: Yann LeCun's Joint Embedding Prediction Architecture (JEPA) suggests that learning in latent space, rather than predicting every pixel, is key to more robust AI representations.

payload.content: AI safety concerns should focus less on rogue superintelligences and more on humans becoming 'reward function selectors' who merely approve or reject AI outputs.

name: AI safety concerns should focus less on rogue superintelligences and more on hum
content: AI safety concerns should focus less on rogue superintelligences and more on humans becoming 'reward function selectors' who merely approve or reject AI outputs.

payload.content: A proposed solution for AI safety is to use inverse reinforcement learning to derive AI goals from observed human behavior, then make small perturbations rather than naive commands like 'end world hunger'.

name: A proposed solution for AI safety is to use inverse reinforcement learning to de
content: A proposed solution for AI safety is to use inverse reinforcement learning to derive AI goals from observed human behavior, then make small perturbations rather than naive commands like 'end world hunger'.
